intro: Galium angustifolium subsp. jacinticum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its delicate appearance and ecological role in supporting pollinators make it a notable species in its native habitats.
